entry.title: See the new baby okapi
entry.summary: Okapis are known as the forest giraffe and are endangered

entry.title: Oversized potplant takes over office
entry.summary: 14 years ago someone brought an ivy plant into an office. It grew very well.

entry.title: Bird-houses in the wall
entry.summary: In the UK, 10,000 bricks that double as nesting holes for swifts have been built into buildings.

entry.title: Gas-powered fly swat
entry.summary: Any good flyswatter ought to be able to break through a hefty piece of wood…

entry.title: Orangutan uses hand gestures
entry.summary: When Amber the orangutan met a visitor called Taylor, her day became focused on a single objective—finding out what was inside her purse…

entry.title: Astronomer photographs rare phenomena
entry.summary: A scientist recently snapped a series of shining arcs and halos of light surrounding the sun in the sky above the U.K., including an exceptionally rare ring of light that circled the entire sky.

entry.title: Artificial leaves make alcohol
entry.summary: Scientists at the University of Cambridge have worked out how to use carbon dioxide, water, and light to make ethanol and propanol.

entry.title: How to repurpose dirty nappies
entry.summary: What’s a dirty nappy good for? After washing and shredding them, they can be used to replace some of the sand used in concrete!

entry.title: Students help find homes for shelter dogs
entry.summary: Students wrote resumes for the dogs so that people would give them homes

entry.title: SpaceX tests new launch pad plate
entry.summary: The recent launch of Starship blew a crater in the concrete launch pad

entry.title: NASA is developing a robot probe to send to Enceladus
entry.summary: It's designed to move around in an icy world and moves like a snake

entry.title: 1000 lego astronaut minifigures fly to the edge of space
entry.summary: They left from Slovakia and the Czech Republic
